updateKeyDialog.title: Update Public Key
updateKeyDialog.description: Enter your new WireGuard public key. This is useful when you change devices or regenerate your keys.
updateKeyDialog.label: Public Key
updateKeyDialog.hint: The public key should be 44 characters long and end with '='

deleteDialog.title: Delete Configuration?
deleteDialog.description: Are you sure you want to delete your WireGuard configuration? This action cannot be undone. You will need to create a new configuration to connect to the VPN again.

dashboardNew.title: Create VPN Configuration
dashboardNew.beforeYouStartDesc: Follow these steps to prepare your WireGuard tunnel
dashboardNew.step1Detail2: Click "Add Empty Tunnel" or "Create New Tunnel"
dashboardNew.step1Detail3: WireGuard will generate a key pair for you automatically
dashboardNew.step2Detail1: In the tunnel you created, find the Interface section
dashboardNew.step2Detail3: Copy the entire key (it looks like: abc123...xyz=)
dashboardNew.noteText: Don't fill in any other configuration yet. We'll provide the complete config in the next step.
dashboardNew.publicKeyHintShort: Should be 44 characters and end with '='
dashboardNew.howToApplyDesc: Follow these steps carefully to complete your setup
dashboardNew.applyStep1: Copy the configuration below using the Copy button
dashboardNew.applyStep2: Go back to your WireGuard app and edit your tunnel
dashboardNew.applyStep3: Keep your Private Key - only replace the content after the Private Key line
dashboardNew.applyStep4: Paste the copied configuration, making sure to keep your own Private Key in the [Interface] section
dashboardNew.applyStep5: Save and activate your tunnel to connect
dashboardNew.importantText: The Private Key in the configuration below is a placeholder. You must keep your own Private Key that was generated by WireGuard.
dashboardNew.configDesc: Copy this configuration and apply it to your tunnel
dashboardNew.alreadyHaveConfig: You already have a configuration. Redirecting to dashboard...
